uk.org.rozanski.oauth_demo.lib

Class DropboxTools

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.org.rozanski.oauth_demo.lib.DropboxTools

  • public class DropboxTools
extends Object
    Static methods for performing some Dropbox actions (creating or printing files etc).

    Note. All paths in these methods are relative to the Dropbox app directory (eg ~/Dropbox/apps/bcs_spa_2014). Dropbox paths always use forward-slashes, even on Windows.

    So, for example, to print the contents of ~/Dropbox/apps/bcs_spa_2014/myfolder, specify myfolder as a parameter (/myfolder will also work).

    • Field Detail

      • DB_ACCOUNT_INFO_FILE

        static String DB_ACCOUNT_INFO_FILE
        This file is created in the Dropbox app folder once the client has authorised with Dropbox. It contains information on the Dropbox user account. It is a Dropbox file path so uses forward-slash as directory separator, even on Windows.

      • DB_REVIEW_DIRECTORY

        static String DB_REVIEW_DIRECTORY
        This folder is created in the Dropbox app folder once the client has authorised with Dropbox. It is a Dropbox file path so uses forward-slash as directory separator, even on Windows.

      • DB_REVIEW_FILE

        static String DB_REVIEW_FILE
        This file is created in the Dropbox app folder once the client has authorised with Dropbox. It is a Dropbox file path so uses forward-slash as directory separator, even on Windows.

      • client

        public static com.dropbox.core.DbxClient client
        a Dropbox Dbx client variable used to perform Dropbox file actions.

        Before using this client you must call createDbxClient().

        See Also:
        DbxClient reference

        private DropboxTools()
        we don't ever instantiate this class but just call its methods statically

      • printDirectoryContents

        public static void printDirectoryContents(String directory)
                                   throws IOException,
                                          com.dropbox.core.DbxException
        Print the contents of a directory in the Dropbox app folder (using Dropbox calls, not file I/O).
        Parameters:
        directory - Dropbox path of the directory to print
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is an error creating the file
        com.dropbox.core.DbxException - if a Dropbox error occurs

        Throws:
        IOException - if there is an error creating temporary files
        com.dropbox.core.DbxException - if a Dropbox error occurs

      • createFile

        public static void createFile(String createpath)
                       throws IOException,
                              com.dropbox.core.DbxException
        Create a file in the Dropbox app folder (using Dropbox calls, not file I/O).
        Parameters:
        createpath - Dropbox path of the file to create (this will be created under the Dropbox app folder)
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is an error creating temporary files
        com.dropbox.core.DbxException - if a Dropbox error occurs

      • createSampleFiles

        public static void createSampleFiles()
                              throws IOException,
                                     com.dropbox.core.DbxException
        Create some sample files in the Dropbox app folder (using Dropbox calls, not file I/O).

        The method creates the following files:

        • DB_ACCOUNT_INFO_FILE - contains information on the Dropbox user account
        • DB_REVIEW_DIRECTORY - a directory for DB_REVIEW_FILE
        • DB_REVIEW_FILE - contains a review of the session
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is an error creating temporary files
        com.dropbox.core.DbxException - if a Dropbox error occurs

      • createDbxClient

        public static void createDbxClient()
                            throws IOException
        Factory method to create a Dropbox DbxClient client.

        The method performs the following steps:

        1. Load the access token using AccessData.load().
        2. Create a DbxRequestConfig object for the default locale.
        3. Create the DbxClient object.
        Throws:
        IOException - if something bad has happened
